TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit ManagedIdentityCredential extends Azure.Core.TokenCredential

Docs.summary: Attempts authentication using a managed identity that has been assigned to the deployment environment. This authentication type works in Azure VMs, App Service and Azure Functions applications, as well as the Azure Cloud Shell. More information about configuring managed identities can be found here: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/active-directory/managed-identities-azure-resources/overview

Public Sub New (Optional clientId As String = Nothing, Optional options As TokenCredentialOptions = Nothing)

Docs.param: The client id to authenticate for a user assigned managed identity. More information on user assigned managed identities can be found here: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/active-directory/managed-identities-azure-resources/overview#how-a-user-assigned-managed-identity-works-with-an-azure-vm
Options to configure the management of the requests sent to the Azure Active Directory service.
Docs.summary: Creates an instance of the ManagedIdentityCredential capable of authenticating a resource with a managed identity.

Docs.summary: Obtains an from the Managed Identity service if available. This method is called by Azure SDK clients. It isn't intended for use in application code.
Docs.returns: An which can be used to authenticate service client calls, or a default if no managed identity is available.
